column4: hi all...i'm having a problem..i upgraded to 8.10 yesterday and i don't know if it's related but my frostwire and other programs are unstable now.. when i try to load my frostwire only a blank screen loads.
for frostwire you could try installing an updated version from getdeb.net
for programs like that are not OS dependent -- you should download and install the new one for the new os
new os -- new set of rules--
the only thing the upgrade did was update system files not programs that were compiled to run with the old os-- a newer version should  make it run .
though I would go into synaptic package manager and remove the old frostwire before installing the new
once you remove the old here is a link to the new http://www.getdeb.net/app/Frostwire
go with the new version
I think I may know why your tops disappeared -- goto system- preference- appearance - then visual effects-- and select none
it is probably a video driver update -- to fix that one-- but that is a fix for now.
see if your frostwire is listed -- in your synaptic package manger--
it would have been under installed -- on the left
click the word installed
then move the bar up and down on the right to see more packages
I think when you tried to remove it-- some of your incomplete downloads possibly could not be removed
other than before you install -- use nautilus then find the .frostwire folder and delete that  ( you would have to show hidden)
lets not worry about that-- the new should see the old
lets try that first
for your reference-- type nautilus at the prompt and that is the file manger
for the default install of Ubuntu (unless you have Xubuntu/Kubuntu or many varients)
yes I just got back
pm?
you should see a tab appear with my name
click it
